meanings.definition: To design or construct (something) with excessive complexity or unnecessary features.
meanings.sent1: He always overengineers his school projects, adding unnecessary gadgets and decorations.
meanings.sent2: The engineer tends to overengineer every machine, making them more complicated than needed.
meanings.sent3: The chef overengineers his sandwiches by adding too many ingredients, making them hard to eat.
meanings.sent4: She overengineers her outfits, layering multiple pieces of clothing even in hot weather.
meanings.sent5: The artist overengineers his paintings, adding intricate details that distract from the main subject.

meanings.definition: One who designs or constructs (something) with excessive complexity or unnecessary features.
meanings.sent1: The overengineers in the company always create products with too many unnecessary parts.
meanings.sent2: As an overengineer, he is known for his intricate and overly complicated designs.
meanings.sent3: The overengineer at the party brought a complex board game that confused everyone.
meanings.sent4: She is an overengineer when it comes to planning events, always adding unnecessary elements.
meanings.sent5: The overengineer in the group project made the presentation overly complex and hard to follow.
